@Yamucha87

You are absolutely right. How dare they protect a software on which they worked for the better part of the last 2, maybe 3 years. The nerve of these pricks! 

These people gave a ridiculous amount of time and effort to make a product you will probably use for months to come, you will also probably vote for it when the VGA's come, but you will not spend 60 euros on it because.... they tried to protect it. Pure crap. 

And that's not actually an anti-piracy measure. Even people with legit copies can't play the game right now because the date-check server won't allow it.

If you want to keep doing what you're doing you're free to cook up whatever BS helps you sleep at night, but don't try to use it as a sensible justification.
